entry.title: The Debt Arrangement Scheme (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2015
entry.summary: The Debt Arrangement Scheme (Scotland) Regulations 2011 (“the DAS Regulations”) provide for a scheme for the repayment of debts in Scotland, and procedure in respect of a repayment arrangement under the scheme, which on approval is described as a debt payment programme (“a programme”).

entry.title: The Protection of Vulnerable Groups (Scotland) Act 2007 (Fees for Scheme Membership and Disclosure Requests) Amendment Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Protection of Vulnerable Groups (Scotland) Act 2007 (Fees for Scheme Membership and Disclosure Requests) Regulations 2010 (“the 2010 Regulations”).

entry.title: The Scottish Sentencing Council (Procedure for Appointment of Members) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations set out the procedure for the selection and nomination for appointment of members of the Scottish Sentencing Council. In terms of paragraph 2(1) of schedule 1 to the Criminal Justice and Licensing (Scotland) Act 2010 (the 2010 Act), it is for the Lord Justice General, following consultation with the Scottish Ministers, to appoint the members of the Council other than the Lord Justice Clerk and the lay members.

entry.title: The Late Payment of Commercial Debts (Amendment) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations implement requirements of Directive 2011/7/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 16th February 2011 on combating late payment in commercial transactions.

entry.title: The Wireless Telegraphy (Licence Charges) (Amendment) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Wireless Telegraphy (Licence Charges) Regulations 2011 (S.I. 2011/1128 as amended by S.I. 2012/1075, S.I. 2013/917 and S.I. 2014/1295 ).

entry.title: The Financial Assistance for Environmental Purposes (Scotland) Order 2015
entry.summary: This Order varies section 153(1) of the Environmental Protection Act 1990 (c.43) so as to add the programme known as the Low Carbon Infrastructure Transition Programme. This change will enable the Scottish Minsters to give financial assistance to, or for the purposes of, that programme.

entry.title: The Proceeds of Crime Act 2002 (Cash Searches: Constables in Scotland: Code of Practice) Order 2015

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Proceeds of Crime Act 2002 (Cash Searches: Constables in Scotland: Code of Practice) Order 2015

entry.summary: This Order is made in exercise of the powers conferred by section 293(4) of the Proceeds of Crime Act 2002 (“the Act”) and extends to Scotland only.

entry.title: The All-Scotland Sheriff Court (Sheriff Personal Injury Court) Order 2015
entry.summary: This Order provides for an all-Scotland sheriff court to be known as the Sheriff Personal Injury Court. Article 2 specifies Lothian and Borders as the relevant sheriffdom and Edinburgh as the relevant sheriff court. The Sheriff Personal Injury Court has jurisdiction extending territorially throughout Scotland for the purposes of dealing with the types of civil proceedings specified in article 3, namely personal injury actions for payment of a sum of money exceeding £5,000 (article 4) or below £5,000 in certain circumstances. Those circumstances are where the proceedings concern an accident at work or otherwise concern personal injuries sustained in the course of work and are for payment of a sum of money exceeding £1,000, or where a sheriff has certified that the importance or difficulty of the proceedings makes it appropriate to transfer the proceedings to the Sheriff Personal Injury Court (article 5). Proceedings so certified will cease to be subject to summary cause procedure, or simple procedure, as the case may be.

entry.title: The Education (Student Support) (Miscellaneous Amendments) (Scotland) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Education (Student Loans for Tuition Fees) (Scotland) Regulations 2006 (“the 2006 Regulations”) (S.S.I. 2006/333) and the Education (Student Loans) (Scotland) Regulations 2007 (S.S.I. 2007/154).

entry.title: The University of the West of Scotland (Amendment of the University of Paisley (Scotland) Order of Council 1993) Order of Council 2015
entry.summary: This Order amends the University of Paisley (Scotland) Order of Council 1993 (“the 1993 Order”). Article 3 of the University of the West of Scotland Order of Council 2007 (S.S.I. 2007/426) changed the name of the University of Paisley to “The University of the West of Scotland” but the 1993 Order remains the principal governance order in relation to the University of the West of Scotland (“the University”), made under section 45 of the Further and Higher Education (Scotland) Act 1992.

entry.title: The Environmental Liability (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Environmental Liability (Scotland) Regulations 2009 (“the 2009 Regulations”) which implemented Directive 2004/35/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on environmental liability with regard to the prevention and remedying of environmental damage.

entry.title: The Common Agricultural Policy (Direct Payments etc.) (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Common Agricultural Policy (Direct Payments etc.) (Scotland) Regulations 2015 (“the principal Regulations”), which make provision in Scotland for the administration of Regulation (EU) No 1307/2013 (OJ L 347, 20.12.2013, p.608) (“the Direct Payments Regulation”), and other associated EU regulations as referred to in regulation 2(1) of the principal Regulations.

entry.title: The Water Environment (River Basin Management Planning etc.) (Miscellaneous Amendments) (Scotland) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Water Environment (River Basin Management Planning: Further Provision) (Scotland) Regulations 2013 (“the 2013 Regulations”) and the Water Environment (Controlled Activities) (Scotland) Regulations 2011 to further protect the water environment.

entry.title: The Charities (2013 Act) (Commencement No. 1) Order (Northern Ireland) 2015
entry.summary: This Order brings into operation section 4 of the Charities Act (Northern Ireland) 2013 (which provides for the transfer of functions exercisable by the Department for Social Development in relation to educational endowments to the Charity Commission for Northern Ireland) on 1st June 2015, except in so far as it relates to applications made to the Department before that date.

entry.title: The Taxis (2008 Act) (Commencement No. 4) (Amendment) Order (Northern Ireland) 2015
entry.summary: This Order amends the Taxis (2008 Act) (Commencement No. 4) Order (Northern Ireland) 2014 (S.R. 2014 No. 300 (C. 16)) by omitting Article 2(2) and (3) and Parts 2 and 3 of the Schedule which appoint the days for the coming into operation of the provisions of the Taxis Act (Northern Ireland) 2008 relating to licensing, enforcement and seizure of taxis. The commencement of these provisions has been deferred.

entry.title: The Consumer Rights Act 2015 (Commencement No. 1) Order 2015
entry.summary: This is the first Commencement Order made under the Consumer Rights Act 2015 (c.15) (“the Act”) that extends to the United Kingdom. Certain provisions came into force on the passing of the Act and other provisions relating to England only have been brought into force via a different Order.

title.div: The Care and Support (Care Planning) (Wales) Regulations 2015 / Rheoliadau Gofal a Chymorth (Cynllunio Gofal) (Cymru) 2015

div.p: Section 54 of the Social Services and Well-being (Wales) Act 2014 imposes a duty on a local authority to prepare and maintain a care and support plan for an adult or child to whom it owes a duty to meet needs under section 35 or 37 of the Act and to prepare a support plan for a carer to whom it owes a duty to meet needs under section 40 or 42 of the Act. These Regulations make further provision about such plans.

Mae adran 54 o Ddeddf Gwasanaethau Cymdeithasol a Llesiant (Cymru) 2014 yn gosod dyletswydd ar awdurdod lleol i lunio a chynnal cynllun gofal a chymorth ar gyfer oedolyn neu blentyn y mae arno ddyletswydd iddo i ddiwallu anghenion o dan adran 35 neu 37 o’r Ddeddf ac i lunio cynllun cymorth i ofalwr y mae arno ddyletswydd iddo i ddiwallu anghenion o dan adran 40 neu 42 o’r Ddeddf. Mae’r Rheoliadau hyn yn gwneud darpariaeth bellach ynghylch cynlluniau o’r fath.

entry.title: The Honey (Scotland) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations, which apply in Scotland, implement Council Directive 2001/110/EC relating to honey (OJ No L 10, 12.1.2002, p.47) as amended by European Parliament and Council Directive 2014/631/EU relating to honey (OJ No L 164, 3.6.2014, p.1). They revoke and replace the Honey (Scotland) Regulations 2003 (S.S.I. 2003/569) as amended by the Honey (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2005 (S.S.I. 2005/307).

entry.title: Act of Adjournal (Criminal Procedure Rules 1996 Amendment) (No. 3) (Miscellaneous) 2015
entry.summary: This Act of Adjournal amends the Criminal Procedure Rules 1996 by modifying Form 16.1-C to reflect the abolition of driving licence counterparts. It also corrects drafting errors in rule 61.9 and in Form 61.6-B.

entry.title: The Community Care (Provision of Residential Accommodation Outwith Scotland) (Scotland) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations are made under the Community Care and Health (Scotland) Act 2002 (“the 2002 Act”) and come into force on 24th June 2015. Together with section 5 of the 2002 Act they make provision in respect of the way in which residential accommodation and residential accommodation with nursing, is provided outwith Scotland (that is to say England, Wales or Northern Ireland), to persons by a local authority in fulfilment of their duties under sections 12 or 13A of the Social Work (Scotland) Act 1968 (“the 1968 Act”) or section 25 of the Mental Health (Care and Treatment) (Scotland) Act 2003 (“the 2003 Act”).
